study_title: Evidence of Late Pleistocene origin of Astyanax mexicanus cavefish
exp_title: Illumina HiSeq 1000 paired end sequencing; Evidence of Late Pleistocene origin of Astyanax mexicanus cavefish
design: Evidence of Late Pleistocene origin of Astyanax mexicanus cavefish
center: Evolution, Genome, Comportement, Ecologie UMR9191 CNRS - Universite Paris Sud
insdc_center_name: Evolution, Genome, Comportement, Ecologie UMR9191 CNRS - Universite Paris Sud
title: SF2_B
description: Protocols: Hyphessobrycon anisitsi and Astyanax mexicanus Pachon cave and Texas surface morphs were used. Sample collection included embryos and larvae encompassing stages from 10hpf (hours post-fertilisation) to 17dpf (days post-fertilisation), as well as dissected brains and olfactory epithelia from adults. Samples were immersed in Trizol (Invitrogen) and freezed at -80°C. Total RNA was extracted from the samples according to the manufacturer's instructions for Trizol Reagent (Invitrogen) mRNA were purified from total RNA (FastTrack mRNA isolation kit (Thermo Fischer)), fragmented (NEBNext Magnesium RNA fragmentation module, NEB) and treated with the TruSeq small RNA library preparation Kit (Illumina) according to the manufacturer recommendations. Final libraries were purified with AMPureXP kit (Beckman Coulter) instead of gel purification to recover all fragments. Library quality has been assessed on a bioanalyzer instrument (Agilent).
